intro: Allionia rotundifolia, commonly known as the roundleaf allionia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its compact, evergreen foliage and clusters of bell-shaped, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full shade. Its leaves are rounded and thick, contributing to its ornamental value in gardens. Allionia rotundifolia is often cultivated for its attractive appearance and ability to bloom reliably in the right conditions.
